article.paragraph: Camp Davidis the country retreat of thePresident of the United States. It is located in wooded hills about 62 miles (100 km) north-northwest ofWashington, D.C., inCatoctin Mountain ParknearThurmont,Maryland."Park Map Viewer."Catoctin Mountain Park. Retrieved on February 4, 2011."Thurmont town, Maryland."U.S. Census BureauUS Census Bureau. Retrieved on February 4, 2011."Frequently Asked Questions."Catoctin Mountain Park, Retrieved on February 4, 2011. "10. Where is Camp David? The Presidential Retreat is within the park however, it is not open to the public and its location is not shown on our park maps for both security and privacy. If you're interested in historical information, visit our Presidential Retreat webpage."It is officially known asNaval Support Facility Thurmontand because it is technically a military installation, staffing is primarily provided by theUnited States NavyU.S. Navyand theUnited States Marine CorpsU.S. Marine Corps.

First known as Hi-Catoctin, Camp David was built as a camp for federal government agents and their families by theWorks Progress AdministrationWPA. Construction started in 1935 and was completed in 1938.cite web12 WPA Projects that Still ExistHow Stuff WorksPublications International, Ltd.http://people.howstuffworks.com/12-wpa-projects-that-still-exist.htmMarch 11, 2009In 1942,Franklin D. Rooseveltconverted it to a presidential retreat and renamed it "Shangri-La" (for theShangri-Lafictional Himalayan paradise). Camp David received its present name fromDwight D. Eisenhower, in honor of his father andDavid Eisenhowergrandson, both named David.cite bookEisenhowerDavidJulie Nixon EisenhowerGoing Home to Glory: A Memoir of Life with Dwight David Eisenhower, 1961–1969Simon and SchusterNew York201031
Camp David is not open to the public, and Catoctin Mountain Park does not indicate the location of Camp David on park maps due to privacy and security concerns.
article.heading: Presidential use
article.paragraph: Every president sinceFranklin D. Roosevelthas made use of Camp David.

list.listitem: Roosevelt hostedWinston ChurchillSir Winston Churchillin May 1943.cite webhttp://www.whitehouse.gov/about/camp_david/Camp David[[White House|Whitehouse.gov]]June 29, 2009

Dwight D. Eisenhowerheld his first cabinet meeting there on November 22, 1955 following hospitalization and convalescence required after a heart attack suffered in Denver, Colorado on September 24.'''The American Presidency Project.''' Note (appended to a prepared Presidential message) wherein the nature and duration of the President's incapacity and recovery.

John F. Kennedyand his family often enjoyed riding and other recreational activities there, and Kennedy often allowedWhite Housestaff and cabinet members to use the retreat when he or his family were not there.citation neededJanuary 2015

Lyndon B. Johnsonmet with advisors in this setting and hosted bothPrime Minister of AustraliaAustralian Prime MinisterHarold Holtand Canadian Prime ministerLester B. Pearsonthere.citation neededJanuary 2015
Richard Nixonwas a frequent visitor and did much to add to and modernize the facilities.citation neededJanuary 2015

Gerald Fordoften rode his snowmobile around Camp David and hostedPresident of IndonesiaIndonesian PresidentSuhartothere.cite webhttp://www.infoplease.com/spot/campdavid1.htmlCamp David: A History of the Presidential RetreatInfoplease.comJuly 18, 1942June 29, 2009
Jimmy Carterbrokered theCamp David Accordsthere in September 1978 betweenPresident of EgyptEgyptian PresidentAnwar SadatAnwar al-SadatandPrime Minister of IsraelIsraeli Prime MinisterMenachem Begin.

Ronald Reaganvisited the retreat more than any other president.citation neededJanuary 2015In 1984, Reagan hostedPrime Minister of the United KingdomBritish Prime MinisterMargaret Thatcher.:File:Thatcher Reagan Camp David sofa 1984.jpgon theEnglish Wikipedia
George H. W. Bush's daughter,Dorothy Bush Koch, was married there in 1992, in the first ever wedding held at Camp David.citation neededJanuary 2015

Bill Clintonused Camp David more as his tenure in office progressed and hosted the British Prime Minister,Tony Blair, on several occasions in addition to numerous celebrities.citation neededJanuary 2015

George W. Bushhosted dignitaries, includingPresident of Russia,Vladimir Putin, there in 2003.cite newsWith issues to resolve, Bush welcomes Putin to Camp DavidSeptember 27, 2003http://www.nytimes.com/2003/09/27/world/with-issues-to-resolve-bush-welcomes-putin-to-camp-david.html[[The New York Times]]August 6, 2011DavidSangercite webhttp://www.losthorizon.org/found/CampDavid /Camp Davidand hosted British Prime Minister,Gordon Brown, in 2007.cite newsBrown to meet Bush at Camp DavidJuly 26, 2007http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/6917760.stm[[BBC News Online]]August 6, 2011George W. Bush also hostedPrime Minister of DenmarkDanish Prime MinisterAnders Fogh Rasmussenin June 2006.cite webhttp://politiken.dk/indland/ECE148638/fogh-paa-besoeg-hos-bush-i-camp-david/Fogh på besøg hos Bush i Camp DavidFogh Rasmussen visited Bush at Camp DavidJune 9, 2006[[Politiken]]DanishJanuary 2, 2014

Barack Obamachose Camp David to host the38th G8 summitin 2012.cite webWhite House moves G8 summit from Chicago to Camp Davidhttp://chicago.cbslocal.com/2012/03/05/g8-summit-moved-to-camp-david/CBS ChicagoCBS ChicagoMay 18, 2012March 5, 2012President Obama also hostedPrime Minister of RussiaRussian Prime MinisterDmitry Medvedevat Camp David.cite webUS hopes Assad can be eased aut with Russia's aidhttp://www.nytimes.com/2012/05/27/world/middleeast/us-seeks-russias-help-in-removing-assad-in-syria.html[[The New York Times]]May 27, 2012
Barack Obamahosted theGulf Cooperation CouncilGCCSummit at Camp David in 2015.whitehouse.gov

article.heading: Security issues
article.paragraph: On July 2, 2011, an F-15 intercepted a small two-seat passenger plane flying near Camp David, whenBarack ObamaPresident Obamawas in residence. The civilian aircraft, which was out of radio communication, was intercepted approximatelyconvert10kmmiflip1from the presidential retreat. The F-15 escorted the aircraft out of the area, and it landed in nearbyHagerstown, Maryland, without incident. The civilian plane's occupants were flying between two Maryland towns and were released without charge.cite newshttp://www.washingtonpost.com/local/norad-intercepts-aircraft-near-camp-david-where-president-obama-staying-with-family/2011/07/02/AGZWpQvH_story.htmlNORAD intercepts aircraft near Camp David, where President Obama staying with familyJuly 2, 2012July 2, 2011[[The Washington Post]]

On July 10, 2011, an F-15 intercepted another small two-seat passenger plane flying near Camp David when President Barack Obama was again in residence; a total of three planes were intercepted over that July 9 weekend.cite webhttp://www.washingtonpost.com/local/jet-fighters-intercept-planes-3-times-over-weekend-near-camp-david/2011/07/10/gIQAEzan7H_story.htmlJet fighters intercept planes 3 times over weekend near Camp David[[The Washington Post]]July 10, 2011January 26, 2015Weil, Martin
